sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Hammer Mill for size reduction of pharmaceutical materials using high-speed rotating hammers to produce uniform particle size.
sections.scope: Applicable to milling and size reduction activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the hammer mill is installed on a stable foundation with vibration dampening.
Verify that all safety guards and interlocks are properly installed.
Check that hammers and screen are clean and properly secured.
Select appropriate screen size based on desired particle size output.
Install the selected screen securely in the mill housing.
Inspect hammers for wear, damage, or imbalance and replace if necessary.
Power ON the hammer mill and allow it to reach full speed before feeding.
Listen for any unusual noise or vibration indicating improper assembly.
Start feeding material through the hopper at a controlled rate.
Monitor motor load and adjust feed rate to prevent overloading.
Observe discharge rate and particle size of milled material.
Collect milled material in appropriate containers.
Monitor motor temperature and take breaks if excessive heating occurs.
After milling completion, stop the feed and allow mill to run until empty.
Power OFF the mill and wait for complete cessation of rotation.
Remove screen and hammers for inspection and cleaning.
Clean all product contact parts using vacuum, brush, or compressed air.
Check screen for damage or enlargement of openings.
Inspect hammers for wear and replace if significantly worn.
Reassemble the mill for next operation.
Document milling parameters, screen size, and material details in the batch record.
precautions: Never operate the mill without proper safety guards in place.
Do not insert hands or objects into the mill during operation.
Avoid overloading which can damage hammers or motor.
Wear hearing protection as hammer mills generate very high noise levels.
Ensure proper grounding to prevent static electricity buildup.
Use appropriate dust extraction system to control airborne dust.
Check for foreign materials in feed that could damage hammers.
Replace worn hammers promptly to maintain milling efficiency.
Wear appropriate PPE including safety goggles, ear plugs, and dust mask.
Follow lockout/tagout procedures during cleaning and maintenance.
